A specialization in Supply Chain Management and Global Sourcing is particularly relevant to those who wish to pursue careers in management consulting, managing information systems, product management and supply chain management. Tory Burch     Under Armour           Learn about Career Development at Stern and view more Stern employers     Student Podcasts  Hear more about the Luxury and Retail experience at Stern from students Sean Kelley, Amy Kovitz and Tory Diamond:     Luxury and Retail Conference at Stern     The Retail Consulting Corp     Retailers Recruiting at Stern     Luxury Marketing Specialization       Annual Luxury and Retail Conference       Planned by the Luxury and Retail Club, this annual event connects Stern students with industry professionals to discuss topics like brand equity and the impact of the economic downturn on the luxury and retail industries    Features top speakers, such as Karen Katz, CEO of Neiman Marcus Group, John McDonnell, COO of The Patrón Spirits Company, L'Oreal Luxury Products Division President Carol Hamilton and Neil Blumenthal, CEO of Warby Parker    Provides invaluable career networking opportunities for students      Luxury and Retail Consulting Corp       Led by the Luxury and Retail club, students gain real world experience through consulting projects in retail brand strategy, competitive analysis and consumer research. Final deliverables include a written case study and presentation to the client's executive team    Clients have included Fresh, Matthew Williamson and Rent the Runway      Council of Fashion Designers of America (CFDA) Masters Workshop       Through the Office of Student Engagement's CFDA Masters Workshop, students advise emerging designers in the CFDA incubator on a variety of start up and business issues    Read about students' work with the CFDA incubator companies in the Wall Street Journal    Read the CFDA blog about the Stern MBA candidates working on the project: Part I , Part II        Doing Business in ... (DBi) Italy       As part of our popular DBi program, students travel for one week to Milan to study the high fashion and luxury industries at Stern's partner school, Bocconi    Students participate in site visits to companies like Versace and Mantero and complete a retail field assignment in Milan      Student Clubs   Luxury and Retail Club   Graduate Marketing Association (GMA)     Related Specializations   Digital Marketing   Global Business   Luxury Marketing   Product Management   Supply Chain Management and Global Sourcing                                                Take Action      Sign Up for Information    Meet With Us    Apply                                                Alumna Profile     Emily Cangie, MBA 2012  Director of Business Development,  The Robert Allen Design Group     Undergraduate: Finance and International Business, Auburn University     Pre-Stern work experience: Financial Services Risk Consulting at KPMG; Finance and Strategy at Nordstrom     Stern specializations: Product Management, Strategy, Entrepreneurship & Innovation     Club involvement: VP of Community, Entrepreneurs' Exchange; Event Chair, Think Social, Drink Local     Favorite Stern courses: Investment Banking, Innovation & Design     Summer internship: Amazon.com, Retail General Management    ------------------------------------    "For me, coming to Stern was about expanding my abilities beyond finance and building on my experience in retail to move toward a more entrepreneurial career path. I was looking for the chance to strategize and execute, and the Stern Consulting Corps - Council of Fashion Designers of America (CFDA) partnership allowed me to do both in one package. Whether it was working one-on-one with the designers to cultivate business plans, strategizing with the CFDA leadership to continue to enhance the partnership with Stern, or networking with other fashion entrepreneurs, the project stretched me to use everything I had learned at Stern."
